Since the next operating room is not available for several hours, the best next step for surgical optimization is to administer fresh frozen plasma to correct the anticoagulation and decrease the risk of bleeding during surgery. Phytonadione (vitamin K) would also be useful in reversing warfarin anticoagulation, but it takes longer to work and is not the best option in this time-sensitive scenario. Protamine is used to reverse heparin-induced anticoagulation, which is not relevant in this case. Doing nothing would not address the elevated risk of bleeding during surgery.
